column7:
COMPANY B provides a unified platform for ESG, Sustainability, EHS, Operational Risk and Stewardship program management, providing functional leaders with best practice workflow solutions that enable program excellence in addition to metric reporting and disclosure capabilities.  We look to partner with organizations that have a vision for operationalizing Sustainability and ESG practices and culture within their facilities and operational activities, modeled after our 25 years of experience in working with organizations to do the same with their EHS and Operational Risk programs.  In order for organizations to be successful and to be able to sustain these programs, they must move beyond reporting simply to satisfy stakeholder groups (internal and external) and, instead, unify cross-functional efforts and operational workflows through active engagement with every person in the enterprise via digital transformation and continuous process improvement.

COMPANY B's target market is mid-cap and large-cap COMPANY Anies with annual turnovers of $1-10B and $10B+ revenues respectively. While we have extensive experience serving a wide range of industries, our ideal subscriber tends to be industrial (manufacturing, heavy industry, pharmaceutical/healthcare, consumer products, etc.) with a fixed facility footprint.   Our target audience is EHS, Sustainability, or ESG leaders who have broad operational and cross-functional needs beyond Sustainability and ESG.  Our typical buyers include VP, SVP and C-suite roles with responsibility across Sustainability, ESG, EHS.  COMPANY B's unified sustainability, ESG, product stewardship, and risk and compliance solutions help address a market that are not interested in or may not have the resources for different platforms for each.  We have seen significant growth in the Asia/Pacific region and anticipate continued expansion in this region in addition to U.S. and Europe as the regulatory landscape drives mandatory climate disclosures in these regions.

COMPANY B addresses this target market by providing an unified, all-in-one solution across multiple digital solutions. By leveraging our 25 years of experience in helping oganizations operationalize Sustainability and ESG objectives through enterprise-wide employee engagement, organizations can build best practices and accountability into core processes.  Our subscriber base also tends to prioritize operational sustainability functions over financial analysis, external communications, or other ESG functions that typically sit with investor relations, finance, or marketing. And since our customers are usually higher in the supply chain, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving ESG metrics, and mitigiating sustainability-related risk are prioritized to demonstrate value to B2B customers.

COMPANY B's strength lies within identifying best practices for data management and reporting that cut across industry sectors and making them available broadly across the COMPANY B platform.  COMPANY B  focuses on facilitating workflows across global organizations. We have prioritized the gathering of raw data and transforming it into decision-useful ESG data that can be presented to investors, customers, and other external stakeholders.  We have an aggressive product roadmap that is informed by our subscriber-led innovation workgroups, which are hosted quarterly, with an in-person meeting at our annual customer conference.  
Where we see greater opportunity in the future is building out more capabilities to support ESG-related risk assessments and scenario analysis. We are building out more tools to support physical and transition risk assessments by integrating more forward-looking 3rd party data and quantifying business impacts in different warming scenarios.
For 5+ years, COMPANY B has developed AI technologies to advance the practice of informed decision making via our COMPANY B AI Advisors.  These capabilities have been applied in our EHS and Operational Risk platforms and will be applied in our Sustainability and ESG platform to help organizations synthesize large volumes of information sourced from various business systems, 3rd party providers, and within the COMPANY B solution.  
COMPANY B also plans to expand our decarbonization solutions to give our subscribers deeper insights into how they can approach hard-to-abate emissions. This means analyzing customer's value chains and aligning with CAPEX replacement cycles to identify potential emission reduction potential and building a clearer path forward to acheiving net zero.
We are also developing additional workflows related to ESG disclosure requests for information and looking to leverage blockchain technology to disseminate ESG metrics and disclosures in a secure and immutable format.  
Finally, we will continue our focus on data automation, Scope 3 data collection and estimation, as well as AI & machine learning enabled insights and advisors.   Response.io on roadmap will be differentiator for engagement/collaboration
95% from software 5% from services

Where there is a clear customer requirement for advisory and/or consultancy work in relation to the ESG Sales opportunity, we will will engage one (or more) of our many ESG expert partners.  For example, we recently completed a large-scale Scope 3 data collection and digitization project for a multi-billion dollar media corporation.  We engaged HXE Partners to complement our digital solution advisory and implementation services to provide technical subject matter expertise related to transaction data and emission factor classification in addition to methodology recommendations.  This combined approach of COMPANY B's digital solution advisory and HXE's technical expertise enabled the client to restate their baseline scope 3 emissions by 1.4M Metric Tons of CO2e COMPANY Ared with their prior estimates via the publicly-available Quantis Calculator.
Similarly, our Partners will engage COMPANY B ESG, where there is a clear requirement for a robust, integrated, digital solution.
Glynt, Urjanet.
GRI, CDP, TCFD, IFRS Sustainability Alliance, Science Based Targets Network

COMPANY B's Subscriber Relationship Management, and Subscriber Services & Delivery teams support our subscribers on a daily basis. They manage and support the implementation and provide continuity throughout the transition to a steady state. To date, COMPANY B has 198 full-time employees that are dedicated to subscriber success and account management with an average of 6-7 accounts per account management team member.

COMPANY B Offers a full-spectrum of support services for a successful and sustainable deployment. Please see responses on "user training" for outline of COMPANY B's user training approach.

COMPANY B actively facilates direct user feedback, whether it is through Solution Innovation Groups, General User "Digg" feedback comments on new features or by posting on our Idea Exchange portal.

When a new subscriber joins COMPANY B, they’re also joining a collaborative community—between us and you, and between you and other subscribers. A number of opportunities exist to develop and strengthen the partnering relationships that will exist when a COMPANY Any joins as a COMPANY B subscriber including the ability for COMPANY Any to collaborate directly with COMPANY B to innovate and develop new applications for the advancement of your specific program requirements;  Opportunities to form/join specialized workgroups with other subscribers who share similar program goals, to create new applications or expand on existing applications; includes the potential to cost-share custom projects that would benefit all subscribers in a particular focus group. 

Additionally, COMPANY B formally established its subscriber Advisory Board in 2016 as a forum for strengthening partnerships with our most active subscribers, with a charter to:  Ensure that COMPANY B continues to effectively support current and future system needs; Provide direct executive-level feedback on how COMPANY B is doing and what we can do additionally or differently. Leverage synergies between innovators and thought-leaders across the COMPANY B Subscriber Community to achieve shared priorities. Generally, the CAB meets via hosted calls 2 times a year, with an in-person meeting scheduled in conjunction with the COMPANY B subscriber Conference (held annually in May). 

For the past 20 years, COMPANY B has hosted an annual User Conference in May, wherein current and selected prospective subscribers are invited to join us for a two-day, collaborative meeting. Each year, the conference focuses on a variety of themes, including holistic implementation from user experience, cutting-edge innovations, a hands-on approach towards learning, and a center on the COMPANY B community. Conference events include training, breakout sessions, workshops, live demos, and Q&A, along with social events and a vendor showcase. 

Finally, COMPANY B subscribers have access to our Idea Exchange portal, an interactive and informal user forum to discuss ideas, needs, best practices, feedback on new technologies, programs, regulations, and processes. Designated site or business leads can log into the forum to access a broad array of focus areas and topics, with the ability to log questions, observations, and opinions, and comment on posts from other users around the globe.

COMPANY B Digital's Net Promoter Score is 9 (Promoter). COMPANY B has several core principals that center our business today, including subscriber First. Our team members work tirelessly to ensure subscriber satisfaction scores are at their highest, and are receiving the support that is expected. COMPANY B tracks subscriber satisfaction through an internal ticket portal called HelpMe! where subscribers rate their satisfaction based on the closure rate and accuracy of the ticket. This allows COMPANY B Support team members to review feedback provided directly by the subscriber and managing expectations. In addition, COMPANY B tracks subscriber satisfaction through monthly/bi-monthly meetings held with each subscriber business to review our SLAs, discuss any projects, questions, and overall feedback. Feedback provided can be tracked by various ways including phone calls, Voice of the subscriber surveys, annual Executive reviews with leadership, and also at our annual in-person conference. All feedback provided is documented and shared with the appropriate channels to stay engaged with our subscriber community and keep a pulse on satisfaction overall.

As part of COMPANY B’s subscriber Support Commitments, each subscribing COMPANY Any is aligned with a COMPANY B support team including a Relationship Leader who is their business representative and available to answer questions from users. This individual coordinates follow-up on requests/problem reports submitted through Help Me! application or is available via phone/in-person meetings for training, urgent issues and/or dedicated user support. Additionally, the lead will work regularly with the designated COMPANY Any Business Administrator to determine launch strategies, identify support needs, and to share on-going COMPANY B updates. This individual is supported by a designated business support manager for the subscribing COMPANY Any as well as the COMPANY B Service Delivery and Product Management teams to ensure subscriber support commitments are met. Every subscriber support team upholds our Service Level Agreements (SLAs) that are outlined in our License & Service Agreement. COMPANY B contractually commits to world-class support commitments (including 99.95% system availability, >90% of user support requests closed within 5 business days, application error response within 15 minutes for high severity issues, and 100% of enhancement requests evaluated within 30 days. Adherence to these standards are reviewed on a monthly/bi-monthly basis with each subscriber and documented to ensure our COMPANY B support teams are providing the dedication and exceptional service support to our growing Subscriber community.

As each subscribing business launches COMPANY B ESG, our dedicated Subscriber Team develops and customizes an implementation launch plan based on the application modules selected, business scale of implementation, and specific needs. This strategy enables each of our subscribers to successfully launch a consolidated program across the entire business as user training is an essential part of success for COMPANY B deployment and support. For each application that is launched, we recommend a combination of the webinar and in-person training sessions facilitated by COMPANY B application experts (in-person session not available during pandemic). The number of webinar calls and the duration of the in-person session is based on the complexity of the application. To ensure the maximum amount of engagement and touch-time with COMPANY B experts, we recommend hosting multiple call sessions to cover all sites in scope across global time zones. The COMPANY B team will work with the designated Business Administrator to develop a training plan and content specific to subscriber needs. We will also provide training to the Business Administrator on maintenance of the system, including adding new users, granting permissions, and adding/archiving sites, etc. COMPANY B also provides several options for on-going training, beyond the initial launch of an application. COMPANY B University is a service available to all COMPANY B subscribers, offering a variety of complementary and pay-to-play training courses, including new user weekly webinars, application user training webinars, application implementation workshops (webinar and in-person), and COMPANY B for Power Users in-person sessions (in-person session not available during pandemic). Additionally, all applications have frequently asked questions, quick start guides, and other help documentation available via Help Me! Some applications also have self-service training videos available for ad-hoc use.

Gross Retention Rate: 95%
Net Retention Rate: 100%

With the increased focus on Scope 3 and supplier sustainability, procurement and supply chain teams are playing an increased role in sustainability initiatives.  We are also seeing growing engagement from investor relations, finance, product engineering, HR, and community relations teams as ESG enCOMPANY Asses many facets of the business.

We are seeing increasing engagement from CFOs as COMPANY Anies prepare for upcoming regulations that include climate disclosures alongside financial metrics.  We are also speaking with Investor Releations leaders more frequently based on the increased interest in ESG performance amongst the investment community.

COMPANY B costing model is based on an organization scale of implementation, rather than per-site or per-user licenses. The scale of Implementation takes into consideration an organizations operating profile, size/scale of the sites that will be using the tools, modules of interest, and intended use. This allows for unlimited system users, driving operationalization of programs through each level of the business. 

COMPANY B costing model is comprised of three components; Initial Setup, Configuration, and Launch (One-Time Cost) including Platform Access and Setup, IT System Integrations, Module Configuration, Organization Setup Training/Launch Support; Module Hosting, Maintenance and User Support (On-Going) which includes annual allocation of user support hours, additional training, and periodic administrative review calls; Custom Project Scoping and Development (One-Time) beyond the current scope of modules/platform.

As standard, the Benchmark platform and ESG Director, specifically, includes a facilitated data collection workflow that includes specified KPI Data Owners that are typically cross-functional in nature with automated email notifications to ensure timely inputs.  Benchmark Benchmark Forms includes a user-configurable data input forms capability allowing subscribers to design their own.  

Benchmark utilizes a wide variety of tools to easily transition data into our system. Our Dashboard & Analytics tools utilizes a DWH that can connect to existing business data warehouse, or businesses can work with us to set up a data warehouse with our hosting datacenter. The Benchmark-hosted Data Warehouse provides unlimited reporting on full data sets and expands ad hoc reporting capabilities (data from additional applications and customized fields) using a non-production data repository and business-specific configuration of de-normalized data sets (fields, labels, etc.).

We also utilize Apache NiFi, a data processing and integration platform, to build internal/external data and integration pipelines. Benchmark Digital has the ability to perform simple ETL, and can be used in batch and stream use caes. It is not just about moving data from A to B, it can do complex (and performant) transformations, enrichments and normalizations. It comes out of the box with support for many specific sources and endpoints (e.g. Kafka, Elastic, HDFS, S3, Postgres, Mongo, etc.) as well as generic sources and endpoints (e.g. TCP, HTTP, IMAP, etc.).

The Benchmark team has the capability to export data to a subscriber's own third-party BI tool and has extensive experience with uni-directional and bi-directional integrations as well as user-driven and automated external system integrations. The Benchmark platform facilitates integrations with modern BI platforms through a variety of technologies such as XML, CSV, XLS, TXT data feeds, Web Services, LDAP Query, ODBC/JDBC Connectors, Data Warehouses, and subscriber APIs. Depending on the business requirements, Benchmark has the ability to make real-time integrations or schedule integrations at specific times based on data volume as well as frequency of data records that are updated. Our subscriber services teams work with users to define the frequency based on their needs and expectations.  Benchmark has extensive experience integrating with utility data aggregators such as Capturis, Enel X, Engie, Glynt.AI, NUS, Schneider Electric, Urjanet as well as ERP and HR systems like SAP, Oracle, WorkDay and more.  We can also interface with building management systems, smart meters, and data historians for additional data aquisition.

Benchmark's Data Xchange Portal (DXP), enables subscribers to easily customize data sets, upload, and transform interfaces; upload and transfer data to & from Benchmark modules and business tools, as well as third-party applications; securely access and share data anytime, anywhere online across all devices and users; publish the business’s Data Warehouse for reporting and analytics; and link data sets together no matter their source, allowing for a holistic view of operations.

Benchmark Digital is one of 10 CDP Accredited Service Providers participating in development of a CDP API that will allow for direct submission of CDP questionnaire responses from Benchmark directly into the CDP reporting system.

In addition to the above integrations, portals, and APIs, Benchmark offers self-service batch upload templates, a Survey Engine for collecting stakeholder inputs, as well as a Supplier Portal supported by unique, encrypted URLs that enable supply chain engagement without requiring Suppliers to manage user accounts to the system.  NO indication of how they collect unstructured data

Benchmark designed Sustainability Reporting and ESG Director to be a fluid data management system where manual input is avoided whenever possible. At the start of the data collection process, Benchmark integrates with other Benchmark modules with operational ESG data (e.g. Sustainability Reporting, Incidents & Measurements) or other EHSSQ management systems, ERP systems (such as SAP), human capital management systems (such as Workday) via our Data Exchange Portal. Benchmark also can build direct integrations with utility providers, integrate with utility data aggregators (such as Arcadia/Urjanet) or scan invoices using OCR technology provided by GLYNT AI. Conversion and emission factors (from globally recognized sources such as the U.S. EPA, eGRID, IEA, DEFRA, CDP, and more) are stored in our system to standardize data and automatically calculate greenhouse gas emissions. Finalized ESG metrics are then be passed from Sustainability Reporting to ESG Director to complete ESG responses, which can then be submitted via API or SFTP to external sources, such as CDP, with whom Benchmark is one of 10 software providers participating in the CDP's API pilot program, launched in Q2 of 2023.

Our EHS and ESG hosting environments are one unified platform that has been developed in-house over the last ~25 years as opposed to acquisition of other software companies, which enables Benchmark's users to have a seamless user experience. This platform hosted on a global public cloud, with mutiple regional options. We utilize a combination of open source and licensed software that are seamlessly integrated and connected on a base platform.  Many subscribers start with a single module and phase in additional modules as their program needs grow, which is as simple as creating a new database to host the data.  The Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) model that Benchmark employs enables customers to stay on the cutting edge by eliminating the concept of software versioning.  Each subscriber will always be using the latest enhancements and capabilities of the Benchmark platform. Benchmark application updates/enhancements are released on an on-going basis to bring continual improvements to the user experience and application usability, with configuration and feature extension options that can be turned on/off to meet specific company program and workflow needs.  Benchmark Sustainability and Benchmark Gensuite are integrated, but still two different tools

Each subscriber has their own dedicated instance of Benchmark with dedicated database or set of integrated databases. We offer world-wide datacenters to in order to keep the customer data within the local regions, each with their own geographically dispersed redundancies. Benchmark also offers opportunities to host data in multiple regions and consolidate via a datawarehouse for global reporting.
Benchmark is a GDPR-compliant company with an ISO 27001 certification. We also in-progress with our SOC 1/2 Type 2 certification and expect to be certified by end of June 2023.

Benchmark works with an external partner to provide XBRL tagging on any documents after the responses have been prepared in ESG Director. Because many of Benchmark's subscribers choose to produce their ESG reports in Adobe InDesign (or equivalent) and in collaboration with external agencies, Benchmark can digitally tag documents once the final product is produced. Subscribers can also produce a content index to append to a finalized ESG report.

There are many ways that Benchmark users can filter and sort data in the system.  In data mining reports, numerous filters exist for operational reporting levels, world region, country, and state, as well as custom groupings of facilities (e.g. owned vs. leased, ISO certified, etc.).  Additionally there are data-specific filters (e.g. verification status, record type, etc.) and custom groupings of metrics can be created for fast aggregation across multiple metrics (e.g. Scope 1, Scope 2, Scope 3).  Project data can be filtered by project type, resources and by savings/cost criteria (e.g. <$10,000 investment; >50 MT CO2e saved).  Disclosures are also mapped to a variety of frameworks (e.g. CDP, TCFD, GRI, SASB, BRSR) and custom frameworks can be created by system administrators and associated with existing or custom KPIs (e.g. internal management systems).

Through years of operational experience and deep understanding of industry best practices, Benchmark modules focus on providing intuitive and user-friendly workflow functionality for designated process owners to execute their tasks & responsibilities rather than simply concentrate on program/metrics input. As a result, adoption of our applications is more broadly based across the organization with benefits across all levels up through management thanks to readily generated and up-to-date dashboards. Workflows are specific to any given module and can be customized on implementation if needed as an additional project, although it has very rarely been necessary across our the 400+ companies that use Benchmark solutions.

For example, ESG Administrators can define which topics and KPIs are material to their organization and assign ownership of topics that are material.  Each owner can then decide the best way to collect the data for their responsibility portfolio - some choosing to route questions to their team; some deciding to gather information from business unit or site-level individuals; or by collecting the same information from multiple legal entity leaders.  This provides flexibility over the data collection process on a topic-by-topic and in some cases a KPI-by-KPI basis.  Benchmark Forms provides a self-configurable data input forms design capability for users.

Benchmark application modules are based off a robust Permission model that allows only authorized users to access the data and take appropriate actions on it based on the module, organizational scope, and access level. As part of standard offerings, role-based permissions can be easily assigned to the users based on the organizational structure (organization, business units, sites, etcetera).  The system will automatically assign application permissions to individuals designated in these roles to ensure that they have the ability to view/edit data for their location. Role-based access is supported and roles can be established by defining a specific set of viewing and editing rights and applying this group of permissions to a set of users. Furthermore, Sustainability/ESG administrators can define workflow-specific roles and responsibilities, such as ESG Program Administrators, ESG Program Area Managers, and KPI Owners, as well as different types/levels of reviewers.

Benchmark offers a library of 800+ best practice operational sustainability metrics and ESG KPIs based on the GHG Protocol and globally-recognized voluntary frameworks including the GRI, CDP, TCFD, and SASB standards.  This serves as a starting point for our subscribers to quickly plug into the solution and deliver value to their organization.  Each company defines Sustainability & ESG slightly differently, so while we have a strong foundation for out-of-the-box sustainability & ESG reporting we can accommodate the specific terminology, metrics, KPIs, and needs of each organization by renaming certain metrics, grouping metrics to align with business programs, and providing the ability to define help text and guidance text to ensure that definitions are understood across the organization.  Administrators also have the ability to create cusotm metrics & KPIs as their program and reporting needs evolve.

As mentioned, Benchmark provides a library of 800+ industry best practice KPIs based off of the GHG Protocol and a variety of global reporting frameworks including the TCFD, GRI, CDP, and SASB standards.  This includes inputs for quantiative metrics as well as qualitative responses and narrative descriptions.  Quantitative metrics can be entered in local currency and units of measure and the system will automatically convert the raw data to business-defined roll-up units of measure and currency on reports, enabling primary data to be collected as-is while driving consistency and eliminating calculation errors.  If a unit of measure does not exist in our library we will add it to our library and work with our sustainability experts and consulting partners to ensure that it converts to the appropriate roll-up unit.  Benchmark also supports calculated values based off of other metrics (e.g. Scope 3 Category 3 Transmission & Distribution Loss calculations based off of Scope 2 primary data).

System Administrators have a variety of tools at their disposal to enable self-service configuration and administration of the Benchmark Sustainability & ESG solutions.   Admins can add new users and administer their permissions (including role-based permissions) in addition to adding new facilities and managing multiple ESG reporting hierarchies (e.g. operational sustainability, legal entities, HR structures, etc.).  Admins can screen in sites for reporting of operational sustainability metrics and determine their reporting frequency and metrics.  If a metric or KPI is not available, Administrators can access a self-service interface to create new metrics and KPIs and align them with reporting frameworks.  From a reporting perspective, each Benchmark subscriber is granted licenses to design their own reports in our embedded Tableau business intelligence solution as well as the ability to edit out of the box reports that are provided as part of our reporting library.

The Benchmark Sustainability Reporting tool has a pre-configured report 'Data Entry Status Report' where users can view which sites have verified their data, partially entered data or not entered data at all. It provides a count of the total number of metrics with data vs. the total number of applicable metrics for each site and also provides quick links to attachments.  This report can be filtered based on organizational structure, reporting period, etc.  Additionally, the Data Verification Report provides quick insights into periods with missing and anomalous data.  In the Sustainability Projects module, actual project costs and savings can be required prior to changing the status of a project to complete.  ESG Director provides a Track KPIs report that provides visibility to KPI narrative progress through phases of the approval process, from not initiated through to finalization.

In Sustainability Reporting, users can mark a data point as an 'Estimate' if the data is not coming from a primary source.  Administrators can run reports based on this designation and quickly find records that are based on estimates and are not yet finalized.  Sustainability Reporting also enables a number of different ways to prepopulate data, including the ability to calcluate natural gas and electricity usage based on the square footage of a facility (using U.S. EIA CBECS factors) as well as a configuration option to prepopulate data from the prior period as an estimate.

The Sustainability Reporting module enables data quality in a number of different ways.  Data that surpasses a business-defined % change threshold will be flagged in yellow with the option to require justification comments in order to save.  Attachments can be provided (and required) on a metric-by-metric basis for full tracability.  Percent change metrics for energy, carbon, and cost are displayed when viewing monthly data for a site to indicate any massive changes compared to the prior year.  The Data Verification Report allows administrators to quickly identify anomalous data across sites and periods - including missing data, data above the business-defined threshold, and data missing justification comments.  We also enable quality estimates of proposed sustainability projects via our Sustainability Prospector solution, which offers a wide range of industry best-practice calculators for measuring electricity, fuel, steam, compressed air, water, and chilled water usage and savings, improving the quality and viability of projects being proposed for execution.

As part of our 2023 roadmap we are also evaluating how to apply AI and Machine learning to further enhance data accuracy, including notifications on anaomalous data and an AI-Advisor to check the quality of justification comments entered into the system.

At the core of the Benchmark platform is a company's operational hierarchy.  Facilities are aligned with various levels in the company's hierarchy (e.g. business units, divisions, P&Ls, etc.) to enable automated roll-up reporting.  Facilities are also aligned with a world region, country, and state (if applicable) to facilitate reporting by global regions in addition to applying the most appropriate location-based emission factors to GHG data.  Custom groups can be created for ease of reporting (E.g. legal entities, owned vs. leased sites, ISO certified sites).  At the facility level, site leaders can define meters and other sub-section of sites (e.g. accounts, buildings) for additional granularity of operational data reporting.  From a disclsoure reporting perspective, administrators have the ability to define multiple reporting heirarchies with any number of levels to facilitate disclosure responses for the appropriate business & functional entities (e.g. legal structures, HR structures) and map back to the underlying operational data.
Leased, partially owned, and JV facilities can be defined in System Management Tools as part of the facility's profile attributes.  This designation can the be used in reports for filtering purposes.

The Benchmark platform supports a number of different business changes:

For facility acquisitions, system administrators can add new sites into the operational reporting structure and screen them in for sustainability/ESG reporting back to the company's baseline year.  Site leaders can import historic data using the self-service batch upload template.  For large-scale M&A activities, Benchmark can facilitate the process of establishing the entities in the system, uploading historical data, and training site users on the system.

Site closures can be managed by the System Administrator by archiving the facility in System Management Tools.  Data entered for the site will remain in the system and users can choose to include this data in reports.  Large-scale divestitures follow a similar process.  The Benchmark team can work with the divested entities to establish a separate instance of the platform for their continued use and work with both entities to migrate data / rebaseline based onthese business changes.

 Complex business hierarchy updates such as business/segment-wide entity reorganizations that require a series of updates and follow-up data transfer tasks will be supported by Benchmark Digital Partners to ensure all data transfers are processed correctly and to minimize impact to users.

column4: User friendliness of enterprise app interface
column7:
Benchmark ESG provides users with a modern UI interface that is focused on providing intuitive and user friendly workflow functionality for designated process owners to execute their responsibilities, rather than simply focusing on program/metric inputs. As a result, adoption of our applications is broad-based across the implementing organization and results in benefits across all levels, up through management. Throughout all Benchmark  application modules, users will experience a consistent layout that includes the following key icons: Add Record, Report, Manage, and Admin options (for select applications). When developing our applications, Benchmark focuses on minimal number of clicks to access information in addition to workflow functionality designed for all levels of users. 

In addition to the continuous upgrades and evolution of our Benchmark ESG solution, application updates and enhancements are released on an ongoing basis to bring continual improvements to the user experience and application usability. A recent example of our continued commitment to enhancing the user interface includes the newly redesigned Benchmark My Home homepage. After a successful pilot with many Benchmark users, we released the update across our subscriber community including giving users the options to personalize their homepage in the following ways: Favorite and Recently used applications displayed, customizing their layout with My Layout feature, reviewing all to-do items in one location across all activated applications which can be saved to their Outlook calendar, setting different organizational reporting scope for each Instant Insights metrics of their choosing, quick access and search for all applications, and also selecting a theme including the newly released dark-mode for preferring viewing.

Benchmark offers multilingual application interfaces and has enabled application interfaces to appear in any local language, based on the needs of a global user population.  Benchmark's Sustainability tools offer 25 languages across the Benchmark platform with the following languages activated by default: English, Spanish, French, German, Russian, Mandarin; additional languages can be enabled as scoped for the requesting customer.  Costs are dependent on the number of languages desired, if the company will be providing translations in-house or requires Benchmark to source the translated phrases.  Multi-lingual projects can typically be completed in a matter of a few weeks.
#REF!

There are multiple ways that subscribers can export their data from the Benchmark Digital modules. Benchmark has worked with a variety of subscribers to digitally feed data from the Benchmakr system to the customer's pre-established data warehouse / BI tool. This data transfer can be done based on the customers preference. This includes the ability to leverage an API, flat-file transfer, or NiFi to feed data to a customer-housed data warehouse or data lake.  Additionally within each module there are numerous reports that can be exported to MS Excel if needed.

As mentioned, Benchmark Digital has numerous out-of-the-box reports available for subscribers. In addition to these reports, the Dashboard & Analytics tool which is powered by an embedded, fully-licensed instance of Tableau which includes various forecasting & predicitive analytic reports available out of the box.

Benchmark ESG currently supports the following voluntary frameworks: GRI, CDP, SASB, the TCFD, and the SDG's. Benchmark will be incorporating the full UNGC and the TNFD in the first half of 2023 and has the ability to map additional frameworks upon customer request.

Benchmark ESG supports the following processes which underpin TCFD alignment: 
Risk assessment through Materiality Advisor module, metrics management and reporting through Sustainability Reporting and ESG Director modules, carbon footprint calculation through Sustainability Reporting, scenario testing through Sustainability Reporting/Analytics, program management through Sustainability Projects module, collation of risk and governance of qualitative and quantitative data through ESG Director.

The Benchmark solutions enable the collection of metrics to measure impact on biodiversity along with the presentation of results in alignment with standard reporting frameworks such as GRI and CDP.  As part of our 2023 roadmap we will also be aligning our KPI library with the TNFD, providing additional visibility and tracking of nature-related disclosures.  Benchmark also offers out-of-the-box geo-spatial mapping capabilities to visualze physical risks and impact.  An example reference dataset established within Mapper is the WRI Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas for Water Stressed and Water Depleted regions, which allows company operations and water usage to be overlayed on this biodiversity indicator. We are exploring the inclusion of additional physical risk overlays as part of our 2023 roadmap.

column4: Other environmental, social and governance reporting
column7: ESG Director module provide the ability to select reporting frameworks, assign responsibilities internally, and manage the data workflow, and generate disclosures. The standard voluntary frameworks mentioned above are embedded, and the EU CSRD framework will be embedded when released, expected June 2023. Users can also design their own custom reporting frameworks, KPIs, and dashboards. Integrated heat maps for water stress
CDP Accredited Service Provider and Gold Level Member, GRI Certified Partner, TCFD Official Supporter, IFRS Alliance Member, Science Based Target Network Corporate Engagement Program Member.

Benchmark ESG has a comprehensive report generation capapbility through the embedded, fully-licensed instance of Tableau BI tool, which enables reports and dashboards to be generated automatically, on an ad-hoc or periodic basis, and distributed to selected distribution groups.  This includes a range of graphic design capabilities, and also includes the ability to export tables and graphics for use in other desktop publishing applications.  
Reports can be pre-populated through the automated workflow that allows data to be automatically processed and presented on dashboards or reports. User can design these workflows to match their own data disclosure requirements. Templates are available in the report library to be modified as required.

Benchmark ESG has a comprehensive report generation capability through the integration of Tableau BI tool, which enables reports and dashboards to be generated automatically, on an ad-hoc or scheduled periodic basis, and distributed to selected distribution groups.

In both the Sustainability Reporting and ESG Director modules the user can create their own metrics or KPIs disclosures. The user has control over the design of the KPI (name, content, unit of measure etc), and can assign responsibility to a person, a role or a business unit.

TCFD framework is one of the reporting frameworks embedded in the platform. Users are able to apply metrics on Governance, Strategy, Risk, and Targets/Metrics to reflect performance under the TCFD framework.  A TCFD reporting template is pre-configured within the ESG Director reporting function.

Benchmark supports alignment with the EU Taxonomy now and in the future. Currently, ESG Director has several optional KPI's that align with the EU Taxonomy and the NFRD that allow you to disclose taxonomy alignment on turnover, CAPEX, and OPEX. This allows our subscribers to identify eligible green activites and the proportion of their financial activities which fit the criteria. 
Benchmark will also support the EU Taxonomy with the adoption of the European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS). When the final ESRS drafts are released, these will be integrated into ESG Director, allowing users to manage that disclosure alongside GRI, ISSB, and other key ESG frameworks.

Benchmark supports companies looking to report in alignment with the SFDR by facilitating the data collection required for the Principle Adverse Impact (PAI) statement. Benchmark's ESG Reporter tool was built for conglomerates and asset managements to collect responses from business units and companies that firms have invested in. Benchmark faciliates the workflows to assign responses at the user- or asset-level, track which responses have been completed, send email reminders, aggregate data across assets in alignment with framework, and create equity-share calculations such as calculating financed emissions.
Firms that are subject to the SFDR can also use ESG Director to compile the narrative responses around the SFDR and align with the Regulatory Technical Standards (RTS).

The Benchmark Supplier Portal allows users to engage with suppliers and collect information to manage supplier performance. Supply chain due diligence surveys can be sent to suppliers to gather performance & compliance information related to Child Labor, Human Trafficking, Responsbile Sourcing, Conflict Minerals regulations, Supplier Sustainability, Scope 3 inputs and more. The Benchmark module leverages industry standard templates that subscribers can use out of the box, while also providing the ability to create custom surveys to gather specific information from suppliers.

Multiple reporting standards are already embedded in the ESG Director module. The product roadmap includes integration of the CSRD European Sustainability Reporting Standards when they become available, anticipated June 2023. The product development strategy allows for ongoing update and addition of standards as the regulatory regime evolves over time.  Many global regulatory frameworks are based off of the TCFD recommendations, which is available out-of-the-box in the Benchmark platform. Where there is overlap, new frameworks will be mapped to existing KPIs in the system so that prior responses can be leveraged without needing to restate multiple times for different frameworks.

The Benchmark Gensuite suite of modules includes regulatory monitoring capability provided by third party regulatory content experts (e.g. ENHESA, Specialty Technical Publishers), allowing users to determine applicability based on site operations, and determine required actions to ensure compliance. This includes disclosure requirements. This allows a holistic view across the EHS, Sustainability, ESG and Product Stewardship domains, and an integrated strategy to compliance and disclosure. 
Benchmark also supports the BRSR in India.

ESG Director comes pre-configured with 800+ KPIS from industry-specific frameworks, such as SASB's industry standards. Users can filter KPIs by sector and industry or use a keyword search function to search through Benchmark's library of metrics.  Administrators can add their own custom KPI's to track any provide disclosures to any industry-specific metrics not currently included in our library of 800+ KPIs. Benchmark can also load any industry-specific frameworks upon deployment and includes advisory services from experienced ESG professionals within deployment to help identify key ESG reporting objectives.

Benchmark's Materiality Advisor is the core module to conduct a materiality assessment. Subscribers can build custom surveys to engage stakeholders and rate materiality topics by measures of probability, importance to business performance, and external impact. Materiality Advisor logs these results and plots them on a materiality matrix and enables optional ownership and progress tracking via supporting modules like Benchmark Project Calendar.

Materiality Advisor is built to support double materiality assessments. While engaging stakeholders, subscribers are encouraged to assess external impact as well as financial importance of material topics. ESG Director can also provide reports on measures of external impact (e.g., GHG emissions, plastic pollution, DEI performance, lobbying efforts, etc.) and compare these data to industry or sector averages of publicly reported data.Indicated they have double materiality features, but limited demo of it during briefing

Benchmark can provide expert advisory services to assist customers with preparing for and conducting a materiality assessment.  In addition to strategic guidance on topics and stakeholders for inclusion, Benchmark can assist with the configuration of the survey template, build customized reports using integrated Tableau software, and generating materiality assessment results and report-outs.

Both our ESG Director and Sustainability Reporting solutions provide users with a configureable workflow. This workflow starts with the initial data entry, whether this is coming in through an automation or manual entry. Once this data is in the solution, specifc users can be prompted to verify the data and kickoff an approval and multi-level verification process prior to marking this data as verified and complete. The reporting frequency can also be set for users to input data monthly, annually, or quarterly and email reminders can be triggered based on this frequency.  Benchmark Forms also provides users with ability to self-configure data inputs forms. Response.io on roadmap; will create workflows around managing requests/response obligations from receipt or delivery.  Will ramp up development later in 2023.

Benchmark's ESG Director provides a workflow process for your ESG disclosure responses.  A KPI is assigned to a 'KPI Owner' in the system, and once this individual adds a response, it is pushed through an approval workflow. This complete  workflow marks KPIs as Not Initiated, In Progress, Submitted, In Review and Finalized. Once an individual adds a disclosure statement or response to a KPI, it is pushed through this approval process where a manager can add a comment on the response, edit the response or finalize.

Benchmark's Sustainability & ESG Solutions provide a full Update History for every data point that is pulled into the system via an automation or is entered manually. The Update History provides a timestamp of when the data was input, the user who input the data, as well as any changes that have been made since the inital data input. You can also select the Record Type to note where this data is coming from and have the option to provide comments and add any supporting documentation such as an attachment each data point/KPI (PDF, URL, etc.).  Additionally, data is locked for editing following a business-defined reporting year end date, ensuring that prior year data can only be edited by authorized users with the Historical Data Administrator special right.

The Benchmark Sustainability Reporting solution enables users to maintain an auditable trail for their data. Every data point that is pulled into the system via an automation or is entered manually has an Update History that provides a timestamp of when the data was input, the user who input the data, as well as any changes that have been made since the inital data input. Users can also select a Record Type to note where this data is coming from and have the option to add any supporting documentation such as an attachment to this line item (PDF, URL, etc.). Users can opt to utilize our verification workflow to ensure that the data is passing through a multi-level approval process prior to being marked as verified. We also partner with a number of third party verification providers for those in need of additional external verification.

The Benchmark Digital platform is a global platform, and due to our enteprise licencing model all employees have the ability to access the tool and play their role in the company's Sustainability/ESG program.  Benchmark offers a variety of solutions that enable team collaboration such as the configurable My Home Portal which enables business leaders and system administrators to create a personalized landing page with program content, links, and messages.  Our innovative U Connect user collaboration feature allows text/audio/video communication between users while adding or updating data in Benchmark modules.  The Sustainability Project module enables best practice sharing and collaboration through a searchable repository of projects proposed, in execution, or completed across the company.  Users can also subscribe to monthly updates on newly approved or completed projects in specific process/program areas (e.g. compressed air, solar, community engagement).  Finally, Benchmark is committed to fostering collaboration and innovation across our subscribing companies.  We host regular Sustainability & ESG solution innovation groups where customers can share best practices and hear latest updates; an annual user conferences in key global regions where users can convene in person to collaborate; a bi-monthly ESG Forum where Benchmark curates external speakers and subject matter experts on leading Sustainability/ESG topics; and an Idea Exchange platform for users to share feedback and ideas across the Benchmark Subscribers' Community.

There are multiple tools for subscribers to engage with various employees across the enterprise who are not primary users.  The Benchmark Homepage can be configured for different user profiles, with certain modules pre-selected for a simplifed user view.  There is also a "My Tasks" section that enables infrequent users to quickly access assigned records and responsibilities to take action.  Dashboards can also be pinned to a specific user's homepage so that it automatically displays upon entry to the system, perfect for leadership who simply needs to assess and analyze performance.  Benchmark also offers an embedded Virtual Assistant called Genny that can help users navigate the system and quickly find answers to their questions.  Benchmark also offers solutions that enable simple data collection from across the company, including the ESG Forms & Survey Engine tools. In addition, all reporting capability has automated e-mail functionality that can be used to send reports/dashboards to various employees.

Within Benchmark Digital's Stewardship & Supply Chain modules, subscribers can use the award-winning Benchmark Supplier Portal to engage with suppliers on various topics. Within the tool subscribers can leverage out of the box suveys/questionnaries to gather relevant information such as Sustainability & ESG performance as well as Scope 3 metrics. 
Supplier Portal allows subscribers to facilitate a dialogue with suppliers to approve/reject responses, add action items for suppliers to respond to, and score responses to individual questions.

Benchmark Survey Engine and Materiality Advisor provide simple tools to engage Investors and other stakeholders for inputs on material issues to the organization. Alongside the voluntary and mandatory ESG frameworks that currently exist within ESG Director, subscribers can also upload custom KPI's and custom frameworks, which is a way to build the workflows to respond to data requests from investors. Subscribers can upload questions from investors, sort them by material topic (such as GHG emissions, DEI, and risk governance), and assign those metrics to subject matter experts using the same workflows as the other KPI's. Customers can then automatically export a sorted report of those responses in whatever format is needed (Excel, JSON, API/SFTP, etc.).

ESG Reporter is the primary tool for investors to collect data from their portfolio companies. Firms can build a hierarchy of their portfolio companies, assign metrics to assets or specific users, aggregate metrics in alignment with reporting frameworks (with the option to automate data entry from the Benchmark Sustainability Reporting tool or the portfolio company's sustainability management system), perform equity-share calculations (such as financed emissions) and create a full data-mining report for deeper analysis.

Benchmark's Survey Engine is the most commonly-used tool to engage with stakeholders. This is used for materiality assessments, employee commuting data for Scope 3 reporting, and other instances of data requests from large populations. For more detailed stakeholder engagements, subscribers can also leverage Supplier Portal across their value chain. For data requests to customers, such as Scope 3 downstream transportation activity data, customers can approve/reject data, add action items, and score responses.

Benchmark's Goal Manager module allows customers to set near- and long-term sustainability improvement targets, track projections vs. actual data, and create action items and assign responsibilities for tasks to help keep projects on track to be successful. This can be used for net zero planning or sustainability projects - whether they are environmental, social, or governance metrics.
Sustainability Projects is Benchmark's core solution for logging and tracking projects for sustainability improvement programs. Subscribers can log upfront costs, ROI estimates, timelines, and impacts (such as emission reductions) within Sustainability Projects. They can then track actual data vs estimates over time.
Sustainability Prospector is another tool that is used for achieving sustainability targets. Sustainability Prospector allows subscribers to generate ideas for sustainability improvements, such as conducting an energy treasure hunt. This tool integrates with Sustainability Projects to generate sustainability improvement project idea sharing across sites and business units.

With Goal Manager, subscribers can set interim and net zero targets based on target emissions or by reduction percentages. These goals are then overlayed with data collected and calcluated in Sustainability Reporting in our Tableau Dashboards and Analytics platform to visualize net zero pathways, show progress against targets, measure CO2 intensity, and compare projects based on tCO2e/$ (i.e., a marginal abatement cost curve).

Tableau is built into Benchmark's sustainability suite, which allows subscribers to generate custom reports and visualize their sustainability data across all their active modules. Customers can view a customizable dashboard with the key metrics they are striving for, measure YOY progress, visualize emissions by location, or many other functions based on any data within their full suite of tools.

Benchmark has a number of out-of-the-box reports, such as an emission forecast report that allows them to project future emissions based on previous years' data. Subscribers can also build scenarios given various inputs such as organic growth or business acquistions for a "Business as Usual" scenario. Subscribers can also integrate Sustainability Projects into their emissions modelling to visualize how their emissions abatement projects can help them reach near-term and long-term goals.  As part of our 2023 roadmap we are also exploring additional capabilities related to climate scenario analysis.  Unclear if they do this for other ESG metrics besides C

Benchmark has a report built into ESG Director that allows subscribers to benchmark themselves against industry- or sector-wide indices across 20 environmental, social, and governance metrics. Using publicly available SASB and GRI disclosures, subscribers can compare themselves to peers with metrics such as absolute emissions, emissions intensity, water consumption, DEI indicators, or board structure.

Benchmark leverages benchmark performance measures from a 3rd party partner integration which includes inputs from multiple industry sectors for comparison. Subscribers can log their ESG scores as well as those of their competitors in ESG Director and pull a Tableau report to show how they compare to each of them.  Seems more manual than others

Subscribers have several features that support the real estate sector. Property data can be requested through Sustainability Reporting with guidance for facility managers and aggregated across custom hierarchies.  Data collection can be automated through an integration with a third-party data aggregator.  If primary data from the property is not available, the system can calculate usage and emissions estimates using U.S. EIA CBECS square footage factors.  Those subscribers can also report to GRESB using ESG Director to manage the workflows of responses similar to other frameworks such as GRI, CDP and the TCFD.

ESG Reporter is the primary tool for investors to collect data from their portfolio companies. Firms can build a hierarchy of their portfolio companies, assign metrics to assets or specific users, aggregate metrics in alignment with reporting frameworks (with the option to automate data entry from the Benchmark Sustainability Reporting tool or the portfolio company's sustainability management system), perform equity-share calculations (such as financed emissions) and create a full data-mining report for deeper analysis.

Benchmark provides advisory support in implementation to assist with industry-specific requirements. We can create frameworks in ESG Director to assist with industry-specific needs such the GLEC framework and Together for Sustainability. In the ESG Director KPI Library, users can filter on the SASB Standards, then select the relevant Sector and Industry to view the SASB KPIs specifc to their indsutry.
#REF!
